form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Markey (for himself, Mrs. McCaskill, Mr. Wyden, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Leahy, Ms. Warren, Mr. Sanders, Mr. Franken, Ms. Klobuchar, and Ms. Baldwin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To repeal debt collection amendments made by the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Help Americans Never Get Unwanted Phone calls Act of 2015 or HANGUP Act.

subsection.text: Section 227(b) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 227(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(iii), by striking , unless such call is made solely to collect a debt owed to or guaranteed by the United States; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking , is made solely pursuant to the collection of a debt owed to or guaranteed by the United States,; and
in subparagraph (F), by adding and at the end;
in subparagraph (G), by striking ; and at the end and inserting a period; and

subsection.text: Section 301(b) of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015 is repealed.
